intro: Nigella latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf sesame or love-in-a-mist, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its seeds, which are oval and dark in color, are used in culinary and medicinal applications. Nigella latifolia thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
